Reviews.Title: “Always nice to find other peoples toliletries”
Reviews.Author: Sinead L
Reviews.Content: I booked the room knowing it was going to be cheap and cheerful, but what we didn't expect was when we went into the room (twin room) we were greeted with the previous occupants soap, toothbrush and razor in the bathroom and a copy of Nuts magazine on the nightstand. Not only this the kettle was full of limescale so when we made a cup of tea it had lumps in it. The room was clean and the bedding had all been changed and so we didn't feel the need to complain right away and we were on a schedule so we had to hurry out and there was no one on the desk when we went out. The next morning on check out we mentioned to the receptionist what we found in the room just so they could pass it onto the housekeeping dept. He looked so shocked and didn't really know what to say. Like I said the room (well the bedding) was clean and it was super cheap (£50), so we didn't want to cause a fuss but at the very least you expect not to find other peoples things in the room, luckily neither myself or my sister were offended by the magazine we were greeted with but I could see why someone else may have been. Would use a travellodge again for the price, but perhaps not this site.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad really”
Reviews.Author: vetty063
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for a weekend at the Park Royal. Well what can I say? The staff where very polite, and helpful. We had no problems with the staff what so ever. However then rooms are another story. All I can say without being too negative is that "they are what they are". It was convienent to get the tube into central London, and over the road you had places you could go and eat, and even a cinema. Overall not too bad, but do bear in mind when you book here, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Below Travelodge's normal low standards”
Reviews.Author: bylromarha
Reviews.Content: Having booked 2 family rooms, we expected 2 family rooms. You'd have thought 2 rooms booked under the same name would be next to each other, or as near as possible. Nope, the rooms were on different floors. Neither had bedding in them for families, despite check in telling us they were fully stocked. We were told the bedding would arrive within the next 10 minutes. 1 hour later, I went down to get extra bedding. Cleaning was poor - we found 3 bottle tops and 4 fingernails behind the sofa bed. Bathroom - grouting was shocking. Messy grouting around 4 cracked tiles in 1 room, round 2 cracked tiles in the second room. One room had a large wet patch at the base of the toilet that didn't go away during our stay. Blinds ill fitting, so light came through with the dawn. Tea/coffee packets were placed in plastic cups - couldn't even stretch to replacing a tea tray. Close to tube - noise of road quieter than trip advisor reviews would have you believe, but the poor repair of the rooms was below normal low travelodge standards.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice place”
Reviews.Author: Nx88
Reviews.Content: We arrived two hours after check in, and as given the keys we found the room hadnt been cleaned however was given another! The rooms were clean but not good quality and things were broken and is was dingy! It was like a place you did not want to touch! It was out of the way of everything because to access the tube station you have to walk a long way to the subway which is a long a dual carriage way. You have to pay for the car park and reception will not change up your notes so you have to purchase something from the service station next door! Spend a bit more money for somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and depressing”
Reviews.Author: paulmarsden79
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute room for Â£26 and unfortunately i'd have been disappointed if we'd paid Â£2.60!! the hotel/hostel was very tired the paint work had been patched up in numerous places along the corridors, our room had stains on the walls in several places where wet items had been flung at the walls - i dred to think what!! the room was generally very tired, grubby and really needed freshening, the pillows were very thin however the staff did give us extra ones and even the bed couldn't offer any comfort. On a positive despite being next to a very busy road the hotel was well sound insulated. My wife thought it said a lot about the clientele of the hotel when the vending machine contained Mars bars, twix and Durex!!! On checking out the manager did ask for an honest opinion on our stay and acknowledged each complaint we had, he assured me that he was a new manager and was in the progress of putting a list of essential updates needed to Travelodge head office - we will wait and see!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Manager called my bluff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MickJ62
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as it was cheap and available at short notice.........but so are many other Travelodges, but with them, you get some sort of basic hospitality and standards that are expected. I didn't mind the noise from the nearby railway, nor guests moving up and down the corridor like Silverback gorillas, I have come to expect such trivialities. However, when I request a clean towel and a fresh soap, I didn't expect the abrasive and rude night porter to tell me 'Its not my job, mate' I asked if someone could get it instead of him, he glared at me as if I disturbed him, and said again 'Its not my job, mate' I went back to my room, quite annoyed about the night porter attitude. Next morning, I saw a duty manager and explained the situation, and said as I'd had no towel and consequently, a fresh shower, could the bill be rectified, he said 'you're joking, mate.......its more than my jobs worth!' I asked if 'mate' was the new 'sir', as I'd been called it 3 times at this establishment.........even the Turkish taxi driver had called me 'sir'.........he laughed and told me not to get too upset about it. As I'd paid in advance, I couldn't get a refund, but AM speaking to VISA about a refund from them. I told the duty manager that I would be writing to the Travelodge Head Office, and his reply was 'whatever'.....at this point, I said I would be posting a negative feedback on TripAdvisor.....and he told me, 'Do what you want SIR, no-one reads them anyway!' I have written to the Head Office, but looking at these reviews, seems others have as well.............and like me, they are STILL waiting for a civil reply

Reviews.Title: “A Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Hobosapien
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this place seem to veer from one to another so let's try to put some balance onto it: This is a Travelodge in a garage forecourt with a subway line behind it and a dual carriageway in front. Yes there will be some noise. As for the place itself, well it's as you'd expect from a Travelodge - broken elevator, dodgy TV, wonky light switch, marks on walls but then it is near central London and cost me Â£15. Regards travel to and from - this is on the Eastbound A40 carriageway which gets very slow in the rush hour. There is quite some diversion to get onto the other carriageway. There is a bus stop right outside for the 95 service to Shepherd's Bush. Five minutes walk away is Park Royal station which is on The Piccadilly Line and just a little bit further is The Central Line. I don't consider transport into London a huge issue. The car park costs Â£5 per day which you can pay online with Ringgo. Would I stay here again? At Â£15, yes. Would I stay here for a romantic treat? Nope

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as other Travelodges”
Reviews.Author: john_ivycottage
Reviews.Content: I am usually happy to stay at a Travelodge. However, I would not stay at London Park Royal again: 1) Very poor night's sleep. We were at the back next to the underground tracks. The trains run late into the night and start early in the morning! We got 5 hours sleep at best; 2) Very limited facilities. No restaurant or similar. Not such a good choice if arriving by public transport. It might be better if travelling by car. There were Burger Kings and Pizza Huts across the road. However the only way to cross over was the subway at Park Royal underground station some 800m away. We made do as best as we could with sandwiches etc from the BP Connect shop next door. Otherwise it was much as every Travelodge. The road was clean, the bed comfortable etc. On the plus side, the staff on the reception desk were both exceptionally polite and obliging.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and handy”
Reviews.Author: richardarb
Reviews.Content: Sited on the busy A40, you may wonder how to get across that 6 lane speed hazard coming out from the tube exit. Only Tom Cruise could get across that road so take the subway which is well lit I'll say that. Hotel works well with the nearby Tube and is oppositte a retail park with restaurants. Room was ok, clean, towels and basics, no remote but managed the TV. Long room, good for desk based work . View across A40 of heathrow bound aircraft. Nice horizon. Really handy for park royal picadilly line tube eastbound into london in 30 mins. That station is a classic, looking like some seaside cliff hugging structure. Added to the atmosphere of a good all round stay. Tube- tastic for central london at around 30 quid.Why pay more ?

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Ian M
Reviews.Content: For a cheap room with travelodge I was pleasantly surprised. You get what you pay for and I got more than I paid for at Â£29.99. Only 2 faults. Mould around the window. No plug in bath/ Apart from that it was very clean . Get a room at the back of the building . Top marks to Mohammed at the entrance office. travelodge you had better keep hold of him if you want to improve the reputation of your hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating, but does the job.”
Reviews.Author: Chloe1989
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently situated about a 3 - 4 minute walk from Park Royal tube station. Although it is approximately a 30 minute tube journey into central London, it is only 14 minutes to Hammersmith tube station and is therefore, in the perfect location to get to/from Hammersmith Apollo as trains run late at night (until approximately midnight on Sundays). The hotel itself is dated, however is no where near as bad as what others have stated on here. Other than a few cosmetic "issues" the room was comfortable enough and cleaned to a good standard. The windows were "triple" glazed to minimise the sound coming from the busy road outside, however me and my partner are both good sleepers so either way this would not have bothered us. Overall, I'd say stay here if you can get a good rate. It's not the nicest London Travelodge I've stayed in, so if you can stay in another hotel for the same rate then maybe go for that.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sammie4
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times over the last few months for business purposes. It is ideally located for the M40 and Park Royal tube station on the Piccadilly line. Hanger Lane tube station is aprox a 10-15min walk (Central line). Parking can be quite expensive at this hotel if you want to park after 6p (Min Â£5 fare) but the reception staff can be quite lenient if you need to park prior to 6p, but this depends on whom is on reception. The rooms are satisfactory for the price you're paying for such a convenient location and the bathroom is light and airy. The room has tea & coffe making facilities which is always a nice touch and there is a working t.v in the room. The temperature can be quite hard to regulate at times so you're either to warm or to cold but this wasn't too much of a problem. Unfortunately I cannot rate or comment on their breakfasts as I did not choose the breakfast option on any of my stays. Overall I would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again should I have business in the area again and, a big thank you to the reception staff who allowed me to check in early (before 3p) without charging me the normal Â£10 additional fee which, is payable if you wish to check-in early (prior to 2.30p)

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Joe P
Reviews.Content: Again, don't listen to some of the reviews below, this is a decent hotel. Stopped here or the American Football and got an extremely cheap room (18 quid for two). I did tube to Wembley (up to Rayners Lane, then across on the Met Line). Half an hour ish. Don't be put off by the noise, I was train side and hardly even noticed, I think they stopped before it was that late and they didn't wake me up either. Overall, worth staying here. It's cheap, cheerful and everything was completely clean (no graffiti, no lost tiles, none of these horror stories). Worst problem- the single didn't have a duvet- and they sorted it out in 2 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Realistic View of Travelodge Park Royal”
Reviews.Author: Salis_Mr_T
Reviews.Content: Just to put some of the negative comments previously written in to perspective: This is a budget hotel in an area where you will get road noise from the dual carriageway and the railway, and it's not brilliantly served by public transport and looking a tad tired. BUT, it is cheap and we found it perfectly clean (bedding, towels etc) with lashings of hot water, tv and free brew kit. Also, contrary to some of the previous comments, all the staff were very polite and helpful. Â£60 for 3 pax incl early check in is, I think quite a bargain, (with no special offers used to get that price either...) To my mind this makes it a decent Wembley crash pad where you can drop your bags, go to the game, then have a few beers near the stadium - before catching up on some sleep, having a shower and then moving on. The money you save on the room you can then blow on Â£5 beers and Â£6 hot-dogs in the stadium! For those who intend using for Wembley Stadium - get back on the tube one stop to Alperton on the Piccadilly Line, then catch a 70, 83 or 297 bus which will take you right up to Wembley (last 2 are 24 hour buses for the return - Piccadilly Line also runs till past midnight, so no need to rush back). Some previous posters might want a reality check, if I could grade good rather average or very good I would.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore most bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Hanky94
Reviews.Content: I was understandably nervous after booking this hotel. However, we were in for a nice suprise when we got to our rooms. I had two family rooms on the 4th floor (top) and I have to say they were clean, the bedding was fine and so was the bathroom. I had rooms 407 and 408 and 408 had a great view of wembley however it did have the Piccadilly line right behind it. Although 407 had the A40 in front you could only hear a faint rumble at night as the window had an extra slider to block out the noise. Double bed was very soft, personally I liked it but I know it's not to everyone's taste. The pillows are very thin so if you're staying for more than one night, take your own. One thing I didn't like is the fact that there was no guest only access to the rooms. I didn't feel unsafe but I feel that needs addressing. One thing that is good about the hotel is that there is a petrol station right next to it so you can get snacks, drinks and even breakfast from there and there is also a fairly large food outlet right opposite with burger king, pizza hut, nandos ect. The nearest tue station is park royal which is a 5-15 minute walk, depending how fast you walk, which is serviced by the piccadilly line which goes direct to Leicester square and should take approx 30-40 minutes in off peak hours. Overall we had a good experience with this hotel and would reccommend it, especially considering we paid next to nothing for it

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: BigRob01
Reviews.Content: After reading the reports on here I was very apprehensive about booking this hotel but I had nothing to worry about. The hotel has had a recent change of management and I had nothing to complain about whatsoever. The hotel is on the main A40 and has a secure car park charging a reasonable Â£5 per night,there is a big BP filling station joined to the hotel,and across the road is a retail park housing ample restaurants and take away's,a gym and a large bowling alley. It sits a mere 9 miles from central London which can take 40 mins to drive on a bad day. If you want a bargain hotel on the outskirts of London then you really can't go wrong. Large,clean rooms with comfy beds,if you want the Ritz you won't get if for less than Â£60 a night which is what i paid to stay here. Stop knocking this hotel as it really is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Worst sleep ever. Seriously.”
Reviews.Author: r_fulton
Reviews.Content: As you may have read in other rooms, the south side has a dual carriageway and the north side has a train line about 50 meters from the building. The trains run until about 1am and start again about 6am. The rooms are small and without air conditioning so get very hot. Unfortunately, unless you only sleep between the hours of 1-6 there is a bit of a system. Go to sleep while the trains are running and then wake up about 2am (when the room gets ridiculously stuffy) and open the window. At 6am you then have to shut the window again. The train is proper loud, to the point where the room rumbles a bit. Wish I'd brought earplugs (The hotel resisted even lending an iron, so I didn't ask) There is no-one on the front reception and you may have to wait a while to get service. Parking is Â£5 at the hotel, but you can park in the complex across the road for free. However this does require you to either cross a dual carriageway or walk 10 minutes around (turn left out of Travel Lodge.)

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: mike f
Reviews.Content: Noise, dirty and car damaged in the car park! don't go to this hotel even if your desperate

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetterfamily
Reviews.Content: There is an incredibly simple concept that the majority of reviewers on this site need to grasp, (and I am not only talking about reviews for this particular hotel). That concept is you get what you pay for. Travelodge is a BUDGET hotel chain, meaning you pay a budget price for a simple, no frills accommodation, NOT you pay a budget price for luxury, 5 star accommodation. The quicker people grasp this perfectly simple concept the better. Our stay was for 5 nights, the purpose being a sightseeing trip to London and our party had two rooms, one at the front and one at the back. There is noise at the front due to the A40 traffic and noise at the back from tube trains. For us this was not a problem, but if noise bothers you then stay elsewhere. The staff we encountered were all helpful and friendly. Parking is Â£5 for 24 hours which is clearly stated on the website and is great value for London. You can pay either via the parking machine on site or over the phone using your credit/debit card. Other hotels we looked at had no parking facilities at all or had rip off NCP car parking nearby which charge on average Â£5 an hour, so the fact that this hotel had parking and was a LOT cheaper than NCP was a factor in our decision to book. There is a garage next door selling a range of food and drinks which is handy. Leave the hotel and turn right, walk for about 3/4 minutes and you will come to an underpass. Go under the underpass for Park Royal tube station and catch a tube into central London. There is also a bus stop at the entrance to the underpass. Next to the tube station is a retail park which has a muliplex cinema, ten pin bowling and a variety of eateries including Burger King, Nandos, Chiquitos, Pizza Hut, KFC and a Chinese restaurant. We used the underpass daily with no problems. The rooms themselves were typical of a budget hotel. You get a plain room with a bed, a desk area, a TV, a bathroom with bath, shower and toilet and a kettle with tea/coffee/milk sachets, that is all, no frills. If you want frills and 5 star you have to pay for it in a non budget hotel, simple really. The rooms were clean and tidy, we got exactly what we expected to get for the cheap price we paid. The thing that let this hotel down was the graffiti scratched into the lift walls. The management really need to paint over this. In summary, if you are looking for budget accommodation with parking (small extra cost), within easy reach of central London by tube and are not too bothered by noise from roads/trains then this will do. If you want frills/luxury and a quiet hotel then this hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible.. in the middle of no where”
Reviews.Author: ali285
Reviews.Content: Placed in between the motorway and the train tracks. basic room, but really noisy. walls and bath room dirty and tiles missing (see pictures). Its also in the middle of no where.. with a mile to the nearest bus route. no restaurants or anything about. You wouldnt want to walk around at night here.

Reviews.Title: “Only for the desperate”
Reviews.Author: johnniehales
Reviews.Content: Dirty room, dodgy lift, road noise and no TV remote. Its cheap for London, but not difficult to see why. Remember to add Â£5 a night if you have to park. AVOID the breakfast in a bag at all costs. Quite how they get away with charging Â£4.50 for a pile of low grade, poor quality muck like that is beyond me.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID ALERT !!!”
Reviews.Author: KevOllier
Reviews.Content: We do a lot of Travelodges and know what to expect. They are often great for the price, you know what you're getting etc - but this one? where do we start? It should actually be condemned and demolished. The reception staff, if they turn up - usually after having to do 10 'HELLO'S' and maybe then knocking on the Staff only door, are unfriendly, nonchalant and obviously don't value the fact they actually have a job. The elevator, dirty and smelling of urine, seems like it's about to give up the ghost any moment. The room - dirty. Only tepid water coming from the bath and shower. The maids only leave one small and one large towel each day even though there was two of us - which means a trip down the stinky elevator to once again rouse the missing and miserable receptionist before another putrid ride back up. On top of that it's next door to a fumey petrol station and right against the busy Central line - so unless you truly have a thing for self loathing - go somewhere else - anywhere else. In fact, consider buying a cardboard box and finding a bus shelter

Reviews.Title: “OK for One Night if Desperate!”
Reviews.Author: ValM1957
Reviews.Content: Left it late booking hotel for Take That Concert so only reasonably priced one in area left. Paid Â£107 for one night. Room was clean but VERY dated, so looked grimy. Asked 3 times before 2nd mug delivered. Blinds completely broken. Road noise not too bad considering how busy. Whole hotel basically needa a major update. Wouldn't stay again from choice. Parking Â£5 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Hideous”
Reviews.Author: sholmes219
Reviews.Content: We paid Â£211.00 for two nights only to have pigeons nesting on our ceiling. The fascia was broken outside our window in room 412 and myself and my partner watched as the birds flew in and out regularly. Then to be woken at five in the morning to hear them scratching about on the ceiling. The whole place was filthy and has put me off Travelodges for life.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Globalfacilitator
Reviews.Content: Disgusting is an understatement. What is going on Travelodge? Dirty, smelly, noisy. If you like your hotel daubed with graffitti inside and smelling of cigarettes and BO then this will be just your thing. I could not bring myself to touch anything in the room. Booked another hotel and left.

Reviews.Title: “avoid if you want a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: birkonian
Reviews.Content: typical Travelodge, basic rooms not clean, stained fabrics. Mattress wafer thin with a dip in the centre. Room was noisy fronting onto main road. Yes it's cheapish but there are other chains offering better accommodation and good value.

Reviews.Title: “one nights enough”
Reviews.Author: syl188
Reviews.Content: only stay at this hotel if its for, 1 night only and there is no room in a near by hotel and you have your own transport----i stayed with hubbie and a friend the web site says 'some road noise maybe heard' what it doesn't say is if you don't hear the road it's because the tube that runs on the other side of the hotel drowns the road noise out!!! getting to the hotel on foot from the tube is much to be desired you have to use an underground footpath and its not a nice area. we checked in at 4pm and never saw a member of staff again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but convenient”
Reviews.Author: BathBabe
Reviews.Content: Ok if you are looking for a romantic break, this is not the place for you. In fact you should back away from the Travelodge brand entirely, your partner will appreciate it. This is London people, expect to pay more for less or pay even more for better. Stayed here for the NFL game in Wembley, convenient for central London via the Park Royal underground station (a 5 minute walk from the hotel) which will take you into the centre within 25 minutes. You get to the underground via a subway which I would not recommend doing on your own at night, frankly that would just be common sense to most people. Restaurants across the road (10 minute walk via subway), mainly chains, but ok if you want something quick on a Sunday night. Was in a room at the front, slight noise from the A40, but nothing major and the internal and external double glazing brought the noise down to a very dull rumble which did not disturb our sleep. As for the Heathrow flight path, we were on the top floor (4) and didn't hear a single plane. Don't know about the back rooms, facing the train lines but can't imagine they're any worse then HGV's going past the front. Parking does cost Â£5 per 24 hours, payment is made in coins (or by mobile) so have change ready. The room (like all Travelodges) was basic but clean. The towels were clean but well used so felt a bit rough. Had no problems with the shower or anything else in the bathroom. The bed was comfortable, the sheets clean. Only one cup for coffee, which was a bit odd for a double room, but we made do all the same. There were no problems with the electrics (I checked each plug). TV's were old but I didn't come to London to watch the X Factor. The lift is a bit dodgy, avoided it after the first time as it took ages for the door to open when you got to your floor (thought I was stuck for a bit) we all used the stairs. The stairs were in the worst condition, very bad damp problem on the walls but as you will only be there a few minutes, nothing to really gripe about. Staff were friendly, although like many minimum wage jobs in this industry, attract people who do not have English as their first language. We didn't fancy the breakfast in a bag, we went out for everything. BP garage next door has most things you should need and is open 24/7. Not a bad budget sleep, If you are looking for a room that costs less then Â£60 per room, per night in London when a major event is taking place on the weekend, your options are limited. This is a place where you put your head down, not where you spend loads of time. If you want luxury pay more.... simples!

Reviews.Title: “appaling disgusting hotel! id rather sleep on the streets!”
Reviews.Author: mumofapest
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my 8 year old son as he was filming at the studios across the road. on arrival i was told breakfast was served in a bag to your room. the lift was dirty and full of graffitti and smelt very heavily of fresh cigarette smoke. the corridor leading to our room had sick on the carpets and down the wall near the linen room! the room i stayed in was 106 and it was disgusting. there was mold all over the bathroom. the toilet hadnt been cleaned someone elses toothpaste stains were on the sink and the floor was filthy. The carpet was threadbare and full of sticky patches, one of which was situated next to the pillow and smelt of vomit! the couch bed had dirty stains all over it and was shabby and smelly. the actuall bed had no matress protector on it and was very very worn!! the kettle was disgusting and the cups had been wiped and not washed as there was still tea stains inthe bottom. we contacted the agency who agreed to move us in the morning so we went to bed in our clothes. on waking up in the morning my son squashed something he saw crawling in our bed. blood poured out of it and it was clearly a massive bed bug. we both had several bites but luckily these were reduced due to us sleeping fully clothed! i am disgusted and intend on taking this further!! i will never stay in a travelodge again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic - with dangerous wiring!!!”
Reviews.Author: KLRNorthampton
Reviews.Content: Check in time was 3pm. We arrived at 2pm. The room was ready but we werent allowed to check in an hour early unless we paid Â£10 extra. We left our stuff in the car and headed into London for the afternoon. Arriving back at the hotel at around 7 we checked in OK, went up to the room and unpacked. Although the room was booked as a family room there werent enough pillows, mugs, plastic cups, tea bags or towels (teabags also werent topped up - 4 teabags for 4 people for two nights is a bit tight!!!) After unpacking we went to put the kettle on (full of limescale - hadnt been cleaned) and found the plug socket wasnt fastened to the wall and could be pulled out - the metal box behind the socket was in easy reach of childrens prying hands - VERY VERY DANGEROUS!!! The hotel offered us another room if we wanted to pack up and move - with 2 very tired children and 2 tired adults we declined. When we left 2 days later the socket was still in the same dangerous condition and hadnt even been covered up by the hotel. The hotel was noisy - although this is mentioned on the website. We didnt find the train track running just outside the window was a problem

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want a hot meal”
Reviews.Author: CJKITTEN
Reviews.Content: The room needed a complete refurbishment stayed at back and the trains every few minutes noisy but tolerable. Guy on check in was ok not his fault the state of this 'hotel'. If you want a hot meal the only way to get it is to try and cross a six lane carriageway plus a four foot high crash barrier and traffic travelling at 40mph - or drive 2.5 miles to turn on to the other carriageway and the same to get back in short starve is safer!

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: alexander32
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 308. The room had been given a once over, but the only thing clean was the toilet. there was hair in the bath and the sink! In the main room there was plenty of space but not a huge amount of storage and no hangers in the wardrobe. The bedsheets were crisp but didn't smell "fresh". There were stains on the coffee cups which suggested they'd only been rinsed rather than washed between guests. Mildew on window and latch was broken, as was the cord to the blinds. The room was not sufficiently soundproofed to keep out the trains. The bed was ridiculously soft and one of the feet was broken meaning that it tipped when you moved. Combined with the noise, my wife and I had an appalling night's sleep. My sat-nav missed the entrance to the car park - I wish we had too!

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE AT YOUR PERIL!”
Reviews.Author: MSLNorwich
Reviews.Content: This hotel is bug ridden, rat infested, tired and dirty Terrible bug bites sustained AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Reviews.Title: “flea ridden hole”
Reviews.Author: jbird924
Reviews.Content: stayed only for one nite noise wasnt really an inssue but it was noisey the main issue i have is im now covered in flea bites and will be taking action stayed in room 106 avoid it like the plaque

Reviews.Title: “save yourself some money and sleep in the car”
Reviews.Author: johnson67hereford
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Travelodges over the years and their warning of some exterior noise doesn't come as any great surprise due to location. However, it is difficult to know which was more annoying; the building facing onto one of London's busiest roads, being situated under the Heathrow flight path , the overground tube line directly behind the building, or the adjacent 24 hr garage. Woken up repeatedly. upon leaving, we had to negotiate around a pile of sick in the corridor (which wasnt ours!) Overall, probably the worst Travelodge I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but a noisy night”
Reviews.Author: Angey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before but it was winter and all the windows were closed. To say it is noisy is a bit of an understatement. It was a warm night and whilst the site does say it is close to a main road if you need the window open it is very very noisy. The staff at check in are most helpful and friendly. The place has become a bit shabby, the shower curtain had that nasty brownish colour at the bottom. It is cheap but I doubt if I will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Its a travelodge not a 5* hotel so what do you expect”
Reviews.Author: Twoooeight
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this travelodge to go to Wembley stadium. It is no different to any other Travelodges i have stayed in. Yes it has the signs of being well used but is clean and tidy. No problem with rooms / beds. Its just somewhere to sleep that most people want and this Travelodge meets that requirement. Slight noise but it is not too bad and this is stated in the hotel info on the website. No problems with the staff. Pak Royal tube station a 5 min walk and has a subway under the road from hotel side. With one change you are at Wembley in about half an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: DresdenTraveller1234
Reviews.Content: Hotel was functional, and room was big. Problem is, there is no storage facility. I was there for one night, and they couldn't store anything over the course of the day. I had no choice but to book another night. Then I found out later the sullen girl behind the counter had charged me breakfast for the following morning, even though it was optional and she knew I was out the door that afternoon. And don't start me on the breakfast - the servo next door would be better value. Although the tube is nearby, there's a freeway right in front, requiring a large detour.... In end effect - your money would be much better spent elsewhere.........

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'd expect from Travelodge... grim!”
Reviews.Author: SLordUK
Reviews.Content: I wish the the companies I work for who book the hotels would stop confusing Travelodge with Premier Inn (or Travel Inn, as it was). Whenever I see "Travelodge" on my accommodation list I groan, and this hotel on the A40 is a prime example of why I loath this brand! What can I say? It's on the A40 - a smoggy dirty road into London; No on-site pub or restaurant; and the rear rooms overlook 5 sets of railway lines (including the tube line) which is conveniently located for a quick suicide after staying here more that one night. The room was run down, there were no curtains, just a blind, a remote control-less TV and an saggy old bed. OK, there was one redeeming feature: the shower - it was lovely and refreshing. If you do have to stay in this desperate place, there is in fact a decent Italian restaurant about 10 mins up the road just behind the tube station. Enjoy lots of good wine here as it will help take away the pain later when you return to your cell. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but terrible, terrible location”
Reviews.Author: Backfixer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located next to the A40, a main road into London, although the front facing rooms have extra internal glazing to attempt to limit road noise. The same cannot be said for the rear rooms which border a very busy, noisy railway line. The trains are so close I thought they were running through my room. In fact I was expecting a knock on the door asking for a second class return to Marylebone. The room was reasonably clean but the mattress was awful. The nearest tube station is a 10 min walk away and you need to go through an underpass to get to it so if you are on your own, I'd think twice, particularly if you are female; I don't think it feels particularly safe. Its cheap for London but you are at least 30 mins from central London by tube. I think it would be well worth paying a bit more to be central, but to be fair, Â£39 a night is good value especially for the capital. If you are prepared to take the tube for 30 mins plus, its a good cheap hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “dont bother!”
Reviews.Author: julezthebrit
Reviews.Content: stayed here 20-23rd november, the first thing i noticed was a distinct smell of mould! as we entered the lift it was dirty and smelt, the room wasnt bad, clean enough but the bathroom looked very tatty, we found that the reception was left unstaffed quite a few times which meant we had to go searching for them to ring us a taxi, 15 minutes it took us the first day to get hold of someone. It is very remote and apart from the garage next door, there are restaurants and a cinema but you would have to walk up to the tube station under the bypass and back down to get to them, i dont recommend using the bypass if on your own as it,s quite scary. I have stayed in many travelodges and this by far is the worst i,ve ever stayed at, basically they should trash it, it gives travelodge a bad name!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good for short stays when value is important”
Reviews.Author: UrbanCookie
Reviews.Content: For those looking for a swanky city centre hotel with all the trimmings for a romantic break, look away, this isn't what Travelodges are about! However, for those wanting an inexpensive base to explore London, there is nothing much wrong with this hotel. I paid Â£29, which for a double room plus sofa bed for upto 3 people in one of the worlds most expensive cities is outstanding value. My room was clean, big enough, with a working shower, kettle, tv, and a decent bed. For those wanting a bargain, what more do you need for a short break? The staff were fine, but don't expect conseirge service. The location is probably the only drawback. You might be under the impression this isn't far from the centre of London... however, it's at least 35-40 minutes on the tube to Covert Garden, although the fares are very cheap off peak, Â£6.30 will get a full day pass valid to Park Royal and and anywhere in zones 1-4, which covers nearly all of London's popular attractions. However, expect to pay around Â£30 ish for a taxi from central London after hours which if you're planning on a night out should be factored in as it maybe cheaper in the long run to get a city centre hotel. The hotel is only 5 minutes walk from Park Royal tube station but is located on the other side of a 6 lane road where the only means of crossing is via a long, narrow subway. Even if you enjoy dicing with death there is a fence which prevents crossing elsewhere. I felt reasonably safe during the day, but wouldn't have relished it late at night and lone females should take note. The only other option would be to walk to Hanger Lane tube station but I would expect this to be at least a 20-25 minute walk which could be equally as dangerous. The hotel has excellent road links however for those taking a car. There are a variety of fast food and chain restaurants directly opposite the hotel, but this requires walking up to the subway and back down so takes 10-15 minutes. There is also a cinema. A petrol station is located next door to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: o0Wolfman0o
Reviews.Content: a disgrace to the travelodge brand! the room we were put in was filthy, stained walls, unclean windows. Just a general mess. In our room there was the remenants of an ethernet cable plugged into the phoneline...something i would have thought would have been binned by the cleaner. No hair dryer in rooms. We didn't drive so we were miles away from everything, location is pretty bad if your not driving. We got into the rickety lift on the first night and it stank of weed. I think its disgusting that the staff be so laid back when informed of the situation. Thoroughly disapointed! On check out i raised my issues with the staff who's lone response was..."ok" not an apolagy nor a care in the world.

Reviews.Title: “surprised relieved”
Reviews.Author: Julie043
Reviews.Content: After reading so many bad reviews we were surprised to find very good service and spotlessly clean room and reception at this travelodge,easy walk to tube for city and sights access, helpful staff, minimal noise from trains and road, food and drink at petrol station next door. Thank you travelodge park royal we will stay with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and basic: a long walk from pubic transport”
Reviews.Author: Lorks
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty standard Travelodge in a location that's easy to get to by car, but a bit of a pain to reach by public transport. We paid just Â£19 a night for a long term advance booking which is pretty decent, but on top of that you've got to pay Â£5 a day for car parking (make sure you have some change: it's cash only, in coins), and Â£5 an hour for wi-fi internet. There is no free carparking anywhere nearby. The rooms are just very standard travelodge rooms. If you get a family room, you also get a sofa that converts into a bed, plus the usual double bed. There is a kettle (but no fridge), tea & coffee, there are no phones in the rooms, and a TV with the 5 domestic TV channels, plus the BBC News Channel, Film Four, BBC3 and CBeebies, plus the BBC Radios 1, 2, 5 and London. The bathroom is equaly basic, with a rather annoying flapping shower curtain. There is a vending machine in the lobby (it has soap and shampoo in - there is none in the room), and a petrol station right by the gate with a cashpoint and a pretty comprehensive shop. The lift is the most annoying slow one in the world - and there is only one! Take the stairs. Noise is a major problem, oddly at the back of the hotel (due to the Central line) however at the front the triple glazing does a much better job of keeping the hum of the A40 down. Compared to the one around the corner, in Wembley, the rooms are smaller, it lacks a bar and a restaurant, but benefits from lots of chain restaurants over the road. Although you may have to drive to get over the road, as the nearest underpass is at Park Royal tube station. Of the restaurants there is a Pizza Hut, KFC, Burger King, Nandos, a mexican (expensive) and a Chinese Buffet (Â£12 for all you can eat, and pretty good), plus a cinema. If you come by Underground, the nearest Tube is Hanger Lane (about 45 minutes walk) or Park Royal (30 minutes): a bit of a pain on a cold wet night. All in all though, a good basic cheap hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Basic Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BigDave40
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about booking this hotel due to some of the reviews. All I wanted was something cheap and clean within easy reach of Central London so that I could spend 3 days away with my wife for a treat. I noticed that Travel Lodge were selling some rooms at Â£20.00 per night and I jumped at the chance of 3 nights for Â£60.00. I paid an extra Â£10.00 for an early check in (normal check in is 3.00pm). The hotel is on a busy road with a train track behind it so I understood that whatever room I was in there would be some noise. There is secure parking which is lit all night and has CCTV. Price was a reasonable Â£5.00 per 24 hours (payable at a machine). I stayed in a room on the third floor overlooking the back of the hotel. There is a train that runs past fairly slowly about every 10 - 20 minutes. I didn't find this a problem as although I could hear it, it was preferable to the traffic noise on the front. I also didn't spend too much time in the room as we were out sight seeing and shopping. But not too bad as room double glazed. The trains are less frequent during the late evening and stop altogether at about midnight. Starting again probably about 6.30 but I never heard them in the morning as I was asleep. But overall really not a problem in my opinion. The room was clean and basic. Coffee and tea making facilities in the room. Iron, hair dryer or extra pillows available 24/7 on request. The desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Bathroom towel rail was missing as in other reviews however it appeared to me that it might have been removed. Perhaps it got broken as the bathroom door clattered into it. Either way not a problem for me. This hotel is 6 minutes walk from Park Royal Tube Station (Piccadilly Line) although the station is on the other side of a very busy road. Turn right out of the hotel and after 5 minutes walk down a slope, under the under pass and back up the other side to the station. Under passes are not very nice anywhere but we never had any problems. I would stay here again as it was cheap, clean with secure parking and in very easy reach of Central London (about 20 minutes to Covent Garden all on the same line).

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: m1niki
Reviews.Content: We booked a Travelodge so we knew exactly what we were getting, and that's exactly what we got! No frills, nothing fancy, just decent, clean comfortable accommodation, 20 mins from Leicester Square on the tube. We booked in advance and got a saver rate of Â£29 per night; we stayed for 2 nights and enjoyed spending our money going to shows and in London, rather than on overpriced accommodation. The hotel is situated on the A40 just past Hanger Lane and there are train lines behind the hotel. We were on the first floor in room 111, however the rooms are triple glazed and we were not bothered by the road noise at all. The nearest tube station is Park Royal (Piccadilly line), less than 10 mins walk from the hotel and across the A40 (via the underpass) there are restaurants, bowling and a cinema. The hotel is also outside the congestion charging zone and there is a car park on site, this is charged via a pay and display machine at Â£5 per 24 hour period. There are signs displayed all over the car park, in the lobby and on the stairs advising not to leave valuables in your car, unfortunately, we saw a car with a smashed window in the underground car park, however our car was parked here from Friday - Sunday with no problem. Be warnde, don't leave sat navs or anything on view. If I had to find a fault, I'd say the towel rail in the bathroom was broken, but is that a huge problem? Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Some TLC”
Reviews.Author: fatmanpauluk
Reviews.Content: Saturday 23rd August. Room 305. Secondary glazing is missing 1 of its 3 pieces, thus making it useless to keeping out a lot of the noise of the permanetly busy A40 into London. See Photo. Towel rail in bathroom broken. See Photo. Requested new room within 5 minutes of arrival. They would "see what they could do". Which in the end was nothing. A poor nights sleep was had and spoilt the concert we attended outside Buckingham Palace. it also caused us to have an early night (9pm) at our next hotel: Travelodge Uxbridge Central.

Reviews.Title: “OK. for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Rosetti
Reviews.Content: As I'd read some bad reviews of this Travelodge AFTER I'd booked it, we arrived with some trepidation! It proved to be OK. 30 minutes from central London by tube & then a 5 min. walk from the station. The hotel was fairly standard:- basic, soul less, but clean & all the staff we met were friendly & helpful. On the positive side, the "mini mart " in the garage next door stocks most things foodwise & also has an area where they serve breakfasts. "Across the road" ( a 10 min. walk via the tube station subway) is the Royale Leisure Park:- a mulitiplex cinema, 10 pin bowling (with a noisy bar area attached) a McDonalds (also in the bowling complex) a BurgerKing (breakfasts served) a Pizzahut, KFC. & 3 very busy restaurants. If you turn left out of the tube station, instead of right towards the subway,you will quickly find 2 convenience stores, a bar & 2 more restaurants (Italian & Indian) A 5 minute walk further on (past a pub!) brings you to Hanger Lane(+ tube) & more shops,restaurants etc. I'm detailing all this,as at first glance the hotel appears to be stuck in the middle of nowhere,which is'nt so..... On the negative side (& its a huge one!) the hotels location is horrendous!:- the A40 into London runs at the front & the traffic noise is a constant 24 hours....at least the tube line at the rear only runs between 6.30 am. & midnight!...oh yes, I forgot to mention the Heathrow flightpath! They could'nt have chosen a worse place to build a hotel (though it is convenient & cheap!) In a nutshell, would I stay at Park Royal again?:- only if I could'nt find anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, so I shoul have read the reviews first...”
Reviews.Author: Kivvy&theElf
Reviews.Content: ...but I didnâ€™t book it, my daughter did as a surprise trip to London for my birthday. We arrived at Park Royal at approximately 2.15pm from Manchester, on a sweltering hot 13th of May, tired, hot and bothered, looking forward to a shower and a relax before hitting the city lights. The place is conveniently situated five minutes walk form the Park Royal connection to the London Underground although via a subway. We arrived at the hotel to be told that we had missed our check in as they had the booking as the 12th. Luckily we booked on line, and had the paperwork stating the 13th. Eventually, after it was established that the morning staff had alleviated their boredom by rearranging computer bookings the matter was sorted. The receptionist humbly apologised for the mix up and told us that although check in was not until 3pm, she would let us go up thirty minutes early....for a fee of Â£20! We declined and spent the following 30 minutes cluttering up the tiny lobby, whilst checking out the empty soda machine, the unplugged coffee machine and the silent and unproductive air conditioning unit. After sitting for 15 minutes we asked if we could use the toilets...the reply ensued thus: Receptionist: No sorry, I canâ€™t allow you to because you havenâ€™t checked in. Us: Checked in? You mean because we havenâ€™t paid the fee you wanted. Receptionist: Thatâ€™s right. If you are not checked in then they are for staff use only. Us: But its only fifteen minutes to go. Receptionist: You are not insured to use our toilet because you are not checked in. Us: I see. So I pay you Â£20 for an extra fifteen minutes usage of the room, then I become insured to use the toilet? Receptionist: You could use the ones at the petrol station across the forecourt; they will let you use theirs. Us: Am I insured to use theirs? Receptionist: I donâ€™t know. You had to be thereâ€¦ Ok the rooms. Furnished in typical Travel Lodge style, basic with a few added extras, (one miniature soap, two disposable cups and a Durex wrapper) we found the bed fresh and clean, although we were provided with two wafer thin pillows and a hand and bath towel in a double room. We did ask for extras, and waited in reception whilst they rummaged around in the back room for more. But, the bathrail had been ripped off and the ceiling and grout were mouldy, all little things that were not down to bad housekeeping but to poor building maintenance. The staff were pleasant enough, except for the lady we had spoken to on our arrival, who peered silently at us over the desk every time we entered the foyer. In the early hours of the first night we suffered a domestic between lovers (oh yes we knew what they were up toâ€¦) filtering down the corridors, and on the second we were entertained by the loud comings and goings of a large party further down the corridor. It would have been even more entertaining had the heated and riotous behaviour been in English, but you cant win everytime. Overall it was a place to rest a head, but disappointing and derelict. Would I go again? Not a hope...

Reviews.Title: “Avoid If Possible”
Reviews.Author: Jo-Worcestershire
Reviews.Content: Booked two family rooms over the Easter weekend for a cheap weekend sightseeing in London. We were fortunate to get a cheap deal - Â£29.00 for the Friday night and Â£49.00 for the Saturday night. However I still expected the hotel to be cleaned to a good standard. When we arrived the barrier of the car park was broken (something that a guest in February 2007 also pointed out). We arrived very early in the day to be told that rooms were available but we would have to pay Â£10.00 extra to have the room early - this was strange as at other travelodges we have stayed at, we have been able to check in early without any additional costs. As we were unable to leave the luggage at the hotel we left it in our car which was parked on the hotel car park. When we arrived back at the hotel we had the last two available rooms one on the first floor and one on the second floor. When we opened the door to our room (room 116) we struggled against the gale blowing through, the windows had been left wide open and it was only the following day we discovered why - the room stank of stale cigarette smoke, the lamp shades were so badly stained from nicotine it was shocking. Surely after introducing the no smoking policy the hotel should have had the rooms thoroughly cleaned. The other room (209) had a stain on the childrens mattress, only one set of additional bedding even through we had checked in with two children for the room and there was a horrible lump of something on the shower curtain. The next morning we went to make a cup of tea but there were no tea bags (I note that a previous guest said they had run out of tea bags on their stay). Good points - close to the tube station on the Piccadilly line, cheap rooms, cheap parking, easy access to M40. Bad points - broken glass by the barriers in the car park, rooms smelt, bad stains, general lack of maintenance carried out at the hotel (hotel is in desperate need to TLC). Would I stay again - no

Reviews.Title: “Dirty shabby place”
Reviews.Author: AlanFrehley
Reviews.Content: Booked in 20 minutes earlier than required and cost me Â£10.00 extra, no teabags or soaps in room. Pubic hairs in bath and minimal toilet paper available. No breakfast option available when checked in, but on departure, was almost charged for breakfast! Wrote to hotel and their Head Office, as yet no reply........says it all really

Reviews.Title: “Just stay off the first floor!”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaAKABecky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night, and it was fine. We were originally given a room on the first floor. It reeked of cigarette smoke, as did the entire first floor hallway. I was ready to go sleep on a chair at the airport. The guy at reception kindly gave us a third floor room instead. That room smelled fine. Just as I was starting to relax, a loud train passed by the window. It was like something out of My Cousin Vinny. Luckily, the train does not run at night and I got up early, so it wasn't a problem. There is no hair dryer in the room, but the guy at reception had one to lend out. Bring your own shampoo, conditioner and soap (they give you soap, but it smells medicinal). The room got kind of humid after the shower had been used. It is hard to find a room in London that sleeps more than two people. The rooms here do have a pull out couch, so it seems possible to cram a family of four into one room. It would not be my preference, but it apparently can be done. As other reviewers have said, the Park Royal tube station is a short walk away. We couldn't find any place decent to eat in walking distance, though. We had dinner at some kind of Slavic pub called The Ring that was absolutely bizarre. In retrospect, I would have been better off with a Snickers bar and a bottle of Coke from the Travelodge vending machines. I saw one restaurant that looked promising, but it was closed dispite the fact that it was dinner time on a Saturday night. It's a Travelodge. It's about what you'd expect (as long as you're not on the first floor). I think I would have been uncomfortable staying for more than one night. I would not stay here in order to vacation in Central London. I would stay here again (albeit somewhat reluctantly) if I needed a cheap room in the general area.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs”
Reviews.Author: cod17
Reviews.Content: Paid extra for an early check in as we were attending a Christening in London and were travelling from Wales. When we arrived to check in early we were told all the rooms were dirty. The so called receptionist looked at his computer and said we had not booked an early check in. My credit card was charged for a one night stay AND early check in. He told me to call the reservations line and to sort it out myself. (This is an automative telephone line you dont speak to people). He had no rooms we were not checking in. He was very unhelpful and our day was spoilt as we had to change in a public toilet with our two children. We ended up taking our car to the occasion, so one of us could not drink. This all defeated our booking reservation and we ended up driving home that night. Reception was so unprofessional we decided not to return to even stay there. DISGUSTING MANNERS FROM THE RECEPTIONIST SHAME ON YOU.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, tidy and good for central London”
Reviews.Author: Riotstar
Reviews.Content: We traveled up from the South West and found the Park Royal Travelodge very easily without getting to heavily involved in the London traffic. The car park was Â£5 a day and pretty secure, with open air parking and under cover available. The hotel is close to a large road, but with the double glazing this is not a particular problem. The lady on reception was very friendly and helpful, giving us adjoining rooms rather than ones on separate floors as originally intended. The rooms were fine; your usual cheap and cheerful Travelodge fair. Our room, 316, had a broken outer window pane, which made rather a loud whistling noise but otherwise it was nice, clean and tidy. The tube station is less than 5 minutes walk from the hotel, and the trip - on the Piccadilly line - is between 30-45 mins to central London. You can usually get a seat for much of the journey, as well. You can get direct to South Kensington (Science/Natural History Museums) and Russell Square (The British Museum). Although the cleaning left a little to be desired we felt Park Royal was a good location for central London, with bargain prices for London!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMancs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as a 2nd choice location as I normally stay at the Kew Bridge Travel lodge. It was during a very hot summer and on arrival the checking in was slow and painful! I did feel sorry for the staff as the hotel appears to be in need of some investment and updating - but the service was slow...and the room overlooked the A40, which was - and evidently always is - very busy. I learnt a hard lesson in that during a hot summer, if you're staying at a Travel lodge, take your own fan!! I slept with the window open as it was so warm and had an awful night's sleep as the road outside is so loud. The hotel seemed a bit run down after staying at Kew Bridge and I came away feeling rather disappointed. The area seemed a bit rough. It would not be a 1st, 2nd or 3rd choice next time. Sorry!!

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge London Park Royal
HotelInfo.Address: A40 Western Avenue, Acton, London W3 OTE , England
